source_id: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_027_chunk1
evidence_span: The creep of Zircaloy is important to the design of fuel cladding, pressure tubes, and other in-core components of thermal reactors.

source_id: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_027_chunk1
evidence_span: Zircaloy has a hexagonal crystal structure and develops a strong basal pole texture during fabrication.

source_id: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_027_chunk1
evidence_span: This anisotropic texture, in conjunction with the hexagonal close-packed (hcp) structure, results in anisotropic flow properties.

evidence_span: For irradiated materials tested in air, it was shown that plastic strain at the maximum load decreased by more than an order of magnitude relative to unirradiated material, especially under plane-stress conditions.
